title: Il Gesu--influence and innovation of design

content.question: Giacomo da Vignola’s use of a wide nave and shallow side chapels in his plan for the church of Il Gesù in Rome proved influential for the design of other Catholic churches because it

choices.label: enabled unobstructed light to suffuse the nave
provided an inexpensive means of accommodating large masses
divided the church into individual spaces that could be used for different functions
provided a theatrical space for the liturgy and processions

content.answer: provided a theatrical space for the liturgy and processions
